title: Weekly Roundup Generator
description: Creates and schedules newsletters in Mailchimp using its API. Newsletters contain articles, videos, and broadcasts published by the organization during the past week and are collected by parsing RSS feeds. The generator calculates the top posts on the Facebook page included in the newsletter using Facebook’s API. It runs by crontab on a CentOS 7 server every Friday at 1 am.

title: Weekly Web Report Generator
description: A web app (Python’s FastAPI + Vue.js) that pulls data from Google Analytics, Facebook, DonorDirect’s StudioEnterprise using their respective APIs; It also provides a web form to enter SoundCloud data not available in their API.

title: Store Switchover
description: Automatically adds products to the `Featured Products` category and removes `expired` products on the first day of the month by integrating with the DonorDirect’s StudioEnterprise API; Built with Python (Typer, PyTest, PyInstaller) and designed to run by crontab on CentOS 7 server every first day of the month at midnight.

title: Pepperplate Snipper
description: The Pepperplate Snipper exports recipes in someone's Pepperplate account as JSON and/or PNG screenshots through web-scraping.

title: The Baby Schedule Maker
description: This page provides a sample nap schedule but unlike most—if not all—baby schedule generators, the time and length of naps or awake times can be adjusted

title: The Office Library
description: An internal web app staff uses to mark log items they borrow or return in the office library. Staff are automatically reminded via email once an item has been with them for more than a month. Before the app, a physical binder or logbook was used and staff would forget to return the items and leave the organization without returning the items.

title: SoundCloud Chrome Extension
description: A private chrome extension that integrates with the SoundCloud API to check whether broadcasts are properly uploaded to SoundCloud. Before this chrome extension, someone logs into SoundCloud and manually checks 30+ broadcasts one by one to make sure it has the correct permalink and title. The chrome extension turned a tedious, error-prone task into something that can be done accurately in a few seconds.
